intro: Lippia nana, commonly known as dwarf lippia, is a small shrub native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It typically grows to a height of about 10–30 centimeters and features aromatic, narrow leaves with a slightly hairy texture. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, often attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade. Lippia nana is often used in traditional medicine and as a culinary herb due to its pleasant fragrance and potential health benefits.
